name: Interesting Topical Mix Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Math: what is the value of X to the zero power, where X is any non-zero number?
questions.explanation:
1 & one.

	X to the 0 power can be thought of as the result of subtracting exponents when dividing a quantity by itself: X-squared divided by X-squared = X to the 0 power = 1.

questions.text: Sports: If a team's WLT is 9-3-0, that means they ___ 9 games.
Geography: Alaska is ranked ___ in area of US states.
questions.explanation:
1 & one & first & 1st.

	If Alaska were laid over the 48 lower states, its southern-most point would be Jacksonville, FL, and its western-most point would be San Francisco, CA.

questions.text: Technology: in the US, dial this number to begin a long-distance phone call.
questions.explanation:
1 & one.

	No local nor area codes begin with 1; it is reserved so switching equipment can route long distance calls.

1 & one.

	Formula: Fahrenheit temp minus 32 times 5 divided by 9 is Celsius temp.

1 & one.

	Military time runs from 0000 (12 midnight) to 2359 (11:59 pm).

questions.text: TV: Joe Mantegna played this part on several episodes of 'Soap'.
questions.explanation:
Juan One & Juan 1 & Juan I.

	He was one of three characters named Juan who were assistants to the Third-World revolutionary general El Puerco (The Pig). Mantegna was Juan One, the others were Juan Two and Juan Three.

questions.text: Highways and by-ways: What US Route is called Richmond Highway from Alexandria to Richmond, VA?
questions.explanation:
1 & one & US 1 & US-1.

	It's also called Jefferson Davis Highway in Arlington.

questions.text: Sci-fi: What is Picard's nickname for Riker?
questions.correct: number one & 1 & number 1 & no. 1 & no. one
questions.explanation:
number one & 1 & number 1 & no. 1 & no. one

	From First Officer.

questions.text: Geography (again): ranked by admission to the Union, where is Delaware?
questions.explanation:
1 & one & first & 1st & #1.

	So they got their homework finished first. 8-) This is why their commemorative quarter was the first issued. Did you catch the common thread in all these questions?
